etymology.description: Phonetic: 才(才) (cái, "talent") + Phonetic: 士(士) (shì, "scholar") -> 刻(刻) (kè, "engrave") phonetic proxy -> 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") corrupted
etymology.interpretation: Originally, the character 在(zài, "in; at") just used 才(才) (cái, "talent") as a phonetic element. However, 士(士) (shì, "scholar") was later added as another phonetic layer. Over time, 士 shifted to 土(土) (tǔ, "earth"), reflecting its usage.

examples.chinese: 我在学校学习(我在學校學習)。
他在图书馆看书(他在圖書館看書)，妈妈在厨房做饭(媽媽在廚房做飯)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài túshūguǎn kànshū, māmā zài chúfáng zuò fàn.
examples.english: He reads books in the library, and his mother cooks in the kitchen.
